column4: ext4 needs another 5-10 years to mature before I'd use it in production
So I assume you won't be using btrfs for another decade or so?
I got burned hard by ext3, never again.
the backups got corrupted too.  Biggest mess of my career
That's why you should keep backups out of band and check them regularly. With a proper backup scheme that situation shouldn't be possible.
I agree it was a budget issue and I screwed it up.  It has made me less of an early adopter though.
wieshka: There should be no need to boot into recovery mode.
you don't fsck a read-write mounted partition, recovery mode mounts read-only
It's a separate /boot/partition, it can be unmounted without being in recovery mode.
How does mirroring it increase the chance of it being "hosed"?
just keep giving bad advice, yer doing great
You can choose to install only a base system.
aacharya: Network manager can do system wide configuration just as well as anything else.
if X isn't running, network-manager isn't either, so no network
which is why the very first thing I do on a ubuntu install is replace network-manager with wicd
